This is done using highly complex and integrated silicon (SiGe) chips, capable of phase shifting and frequency translation functions, and operation up to 100C. Measured patterns and communication links capable of 2-4 Gbps over hundreds of meters will be shown.

title: Evolutionary Algorithm for Segmentation of Medical Images by Region Rrowing
conferenceTitle: 2016 13th International Conference on Computer Graphics, Imaging and Visualization (CGiV)
abstract: Image segmentation by region growing method is robust fast and very easy to implemented, but it suffers from: the threshold problem, initialization, and sensitivity to noise. Evolutionary algorithms are particular methods for optimizing functions, they have a great ability to find the global optimum of a problem. In this paper, we used evolutionary algorithms to get over the three problems. We have proposed a segmentation method based on region growing and evolutionary algorithms. The proposed approach is validated on four hundred synthetic images and medical. The results show the good performance of this approach.

title: Research on distributed emergency resource scheduling system based on Internet of Things
conferenceTitle: 2016 Chinese Control and Decision Conference (CCDC)
abstract: Emergency departments and emergency resources as smart objects can perceive other objects on environment of emergency events and directly interact with surroundings, that can achieve self-determination and control by IOT technologies. Therefore, the methods that tasks are completed with distributed scheduling by emergency departments have advantages. The feasibility is explored emergency resource scheduling with intelligent and decentralized decision features based on IOT. The methods of scheduling modeling that have been autonomous, cooperative and dynamic are analyzed. The guidance and suggestions for theory system, modeling and solving mechanism are provided to the emergency resource scheduling theory on this research.

title: Session 1: HEVC in embedded systems
conferenceTitle: 2016 Conference on Design and Architectures for Signal and Image Processing (DASIP)
abstract: This session should appeal to the researchers interested in the latest implementations of the MPEG standard in embedded platforms. The four papers propose cope with performance, energy and complexity issues. From different points of view, two of them deals with the Scalable standard. One presents an efficient parallel architecture while the other one analyses the existing trade-off between energy consumption and quality. Encoding complexity estimates are discussed in the third paper. The last paper comes back to the energy efficiency issue using a task-based programming model.

title: Modular training complexes for technical disciplines
conferenceTitle: 2016 13th International Scientific-Technical Conference on Actual Problems of Electronics Instrument Engineering (APEIE)
abstract: Presented modular training systems for technical subjects on the courses “Physics”, “Physical fundamentals of electronics”, “Fundamentals of electronics and circuit design”, “Electrical Engineering”, “Electric machines and the basis of electron-troprivoda”, “Elektroradiomaterialy”, “Radio-technical systems.” The characteristics of the complexes, their composition and features of the application.

title: Technical profiles for mexican internet user to improve informatics security
conferenceTitle: 2016 8th Euro American Conference on Telematics and Information Systems (EATIS)
abstract: In this work we present technical profiles for computer and Internet user. These profiles are made taking in account academic formation from high school to undergraduate studies in Mexico. We have analyzed high school schedules from the most important Mexican Universities. We made a similar task with undergraduate studies considering engineering, social and humanistic careers and also medical and health studies. We consider to do this work technical training, international standards about Informatics Security, Data Centers installation and operation standards. We propose four profiles including knowledge, competence for computer and Internet users to improve the Informatics Security and to prevent risks about cybercrime.

title: Too big to fail?
conferenceTitle: 2016 IEEE-IAS/PCA Cement Industry Technical Conference
abstract: The cement industry relies upon silos for storage of materials throughout the process of the creation of cement. Many arrive on site at a production facility fully realizing that mechanical systems and equipment need maintenance, but never think twice about their storage structures. Unfortunately, this can lead to tragic consequences for facility personnel as attested to by past failures. Many factors affect the behavior of storage silos. From the type of silo (raw material, blending, clinker, finish cement, and beyond), reclaim system, feeding system, construction date, contractor, design engineer, modifications to the structure, and more, there are many factors that can affect the behavior of a silo. Fortunately, silos typically give notices and warnings prior to failure. Observation of cracking patterns, concrete chunks in reclaim, delaminating and spalling concrete, and others can be sure indicators that something unintended is happening with your silos. A silo inspection by an experienced engineer can make sense of what the silo is telling us. Not all cracks are created the same, and different cracking patterns mean different issues. Silos, especially those around cement production, have their own unique issues. From abrasion and impact loads, to asymmetric flow, over pressurization from pneumatic feed systems, rat holing and bridging, differential foundation settlement can lead to disastrous results that could be better managed with the creation and implementation of an inspection program. This paper will discuss: Some of these warning signs in detail,; Failure modes (from hopper to wall connection failures, wall damage, roof beam support issues and collapse) in silos,; Give owners tips on what to seek during their plant walk downs, and show how an inspection program can arm owners of silos, both at individual plants as well as a fleet of facilities with information for their future planning.

title: Training hidden Markov models on incomplete sequences
conferenceTitle: 2016 13th International Scientific-Technical Conference on Actual Problems of Electronics Instrument Engineering (APEIE)
abstract: This paper deals with the algorithms of training hidden Markov models on sequences with missing observations. The method of imputation using Viterbi algorithm and the method of marginalization of missing observations are studied. These two methods are compared to the standard methods of dealing with missing data: imputation of gaps using the mode (the most frequent value) of nearest observations and gluing of observable parts of the sequence. The studied methods appeared to be more effective than the standard ones. Although the marginalization method proved to be a bit more effective than the method of imputation using Viterbi algorithm.

title: The present and future of Moore's law
conferenceTitle: 2016 International Symposium on VLSI Design, Automation and Test (VLSI-DAT)
abstract: I will give an overview of industry leading and state of art Intel 14nm technology, present key results and enabling innovations, and highlight technology values for the products. I will briefly review the history of Moore's law, discuss challenges for continual silicon scaling, and describe important vectors in advancing Moore's law in the future.

title: A comparative study of optical fiber sensors for refractive index measurement
conferenceTitle: 2016 National Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Biomedical Engineering (ELECO)
abstract: Refractive index (RI) is one of the physical properties of material, such as boiling/ melting point, density, and elasticity. As one of the distinctive features of the material, measurement of the RI is nowadays used in many areas including the food, oil and petroleum industry, biomedical applications, and environmental analysis. In recent years, fiber optic based refractometers become highly popular thanks to the advantages they provide compared to other methods used in the above mentioned fields. Two fiber optic refractive index sensors were investigated in this study: Fresnel reflection based- and long-period fiber grating (LPFG) based-refractometers. The former uses SMF fiber tip as sensing point interrogated by an OTDR from a distant location, where the latter examines the changes in the resonance wavelength. Experimental work realised on different concentrations of glucose-water and glycerol-water solutions successfully demonstrated the capability of the proposed sensor in measuring RI of liquid chemicals with a precision of 1.7×10-4 (Fresnel-based sensor) and maximum sensitivity of 193.42 nm/RIU (LPGF based sensor).

title: Experience in the application of modular teaching complexes in working with deaf students
conferenceTitle: 2016 13th International Scientific-Technical Conference on Actual Problems of Electronics Instrument Engineering (APEIE)
abstract: Reviewed experience with the application of modular teaching complexes while working with deaf Technical University students. It is shown that their use contributes to mainstreaming vocational and personal development of students.

title: Study of Image Enhancement Algorithms in Coal Mine
conferenceTitle: 2016 8th International Conference on Intelligent Human-Machine Systems and Cybernetics (IHMSC)
abstract: For the problem of uneven illumination of the image in the underground of coal mine, we have carried on the deep research to the common several kinds of enhancement theory, which can improve the visual effect of the uneven illumination image. Then, we analyzed the relative parameters of spatial statistical properties of gray scale images. At last, we make an objective evaluation of the image quality. The theory analyses and experiments show that the method of histogram equalization image enhancement can achieve satisfactory results in dealing with the contrast of the image is not very low or intensity distribution is relatively dense.

title: A particle filtering approach for noisy seismic events tracking
conferenceTitle: 2016 International Symposium on Intelligent Signal Processing and Communication Systems (ISPACS)
abstract: This paper addresses the extraction of the seismic events from noisy seismic records. Seismic signals are nonlinear and can be modeled by a nonlinear dynamical system. Accurate estimation of seismic signals is very important in geological structure studies. It is typical that the signal is corrupted by noise, especially during the data acquisition process. This results in the loss of important information embedded in the measured or the acquired data. This work proposes the particle filtering, a class of sequential Monte Carlo methods, along with the seismic wavelet model for the tracking of the seismic events of the noisy seismic signals. The method is evaluated on the synthetic noisy data with different noise levels. Moreover, the method is tested on multiple events seismic records to show its performance when the signals are more complex. Simulation results demonstrated that the proposed method delivers excellent seismic event estimates under noisy observations.

title: Polarization holographic gratings in liquid crystal composites doped nanoparticles
conferenceTitle: 2016 13th International Scientific-Technical Conference on Actual Problems of Electronics Instrument Engineering (APEIE)
abstract: The influence of additives nanoparticles carbon nanofibers, SiO2, ZnO, Al2O3, Y2O3 on the properties of liquid crystal composites formed by polarization holography was investigated. The effect of additives nanoparticles on the phase transition temperature, controlling the electric field and the diffraction efficiency of polarization holographic gratings was shown.

title: Coupled vector FEM and scalar BEM formulation for eddy current problems
conferenceTitle: 2016 13th International Scientific-Technical Conference on Actual Problems of Electronics Instrument Engineering (APEIE)
abstract: A problem of electromagnetic field modeling with consideration of eddy currents is addressed. A formulation for calculating eddy currents with coupled total vector magnetic potential and reduced scalar magnetic potential is presented. The finite element method (FEM) is used to approximate the total vector magnetic potential and the boundary element method (BEM) is used to approximate reduced scalar magnetic potential. The efficiency of the proposed method is investigated and compared to the pure FEM formulation. The results are obtained by solving the problem of calculating the effect of eddy currents on a magnet activation.

title: Hybrid Electric Car Fuel Consumption Optimization Research Based on Improved Genetic Algorithm
conferenceTitle: 2016 International Conference on Intelligent Transportation, Big Data & Smart City (ICITBS)
abstract: Hybrid electric car fuel consumption optimization based on fuzzy control strategy has strong subjective dependence, and the control results cannot reach the most optimal value. So a kind of improved genetic algorithm is introduced into optimization of control rule. According to genetic algorithm theory, the vehicle fuel consumption and emissions are taken as the objective function and fitness function is determined by weighting method. In order to simplify the coding method for genetic operation process, decimal integer coding method is used for variable encoding of rules. The optimization control strategy model is imported into vehicle model for simulation. The results show that the optimized control strategy based on improved genetic algorithm has better performance than basic genetic algorithm.

title: Fast intra-beam switching scheme using common contention channels in millimeter-wave based cellular systems
conferenceTitle: 2016 18th International Conference on Advanced Communication Technology (ICACT)
abstract: Millimeter wave (mmWave) cellular system has recently been introduced as an attractive approach for 5G mobile broadband communications. In the mmWave beamforming cellular systems, the user equipment (UE) can experience frequent service disruptions due to frequent switching among a plurality of beams if the UE follows the network controlled LTE handover procedures. In this paper, we shows how the mmWave beamforming cellular system can operate and which kind of new handovers UEs can experience. And we propose UE controlled beam switching mechanism based on contention based uplink channels. In this mechanism, UEs switch the serving beam to the target beam without random access delay using the pre-acquired contention based channels.

title: The analysis of distribute inter-cell interference control efficiency algorithms of in LTE
conferenceTitle: 2016 13th International Scientific-Technical Conference on Actual Problems of Electronics Instrument Engineering (APEIE)
abstract: This article covers some key approaches to solve the problem of reducing inter-cell interference in wireless networks, such as LTE, caused by lack of frequency reuse principle. On the basis of the author's simulation model it was done a comparative analysis of the existing solution in terms of achievable throughput and the probability of blocking the traffic channel PUSCH and PDSCH. The simulation results demonstrate the inefficient usage of time domain resources at the cell edges between subscribers served by different stations, as part of any inter-cell interference coordination procedures.

title: Research of electromagnetic forces electromagnetic actuator at fluctuations of anchor
conferenceTitle: 2016 13th International Scientific-Technical Conference on Actual Problems of Electronics Instrument Engineering (APEIE)
abstract: By results of analytical and experimental researches of electromagnetic forces in oscillatory process of movement of anchor of electromagnetic actuator are submitted the proofs of basic divergence of settlement and experimental sizes of electromagnetic forces.

title: Geographically weighted regression: Fitting to spatial location
conferenceTitle: 2016 13th International Scientific-Technical Conference on Actual Problems of Electronics Instrument Engineering (APEIE)
abstract: A popular tool for identifying the relationships on spatial data is geographically weighted regression (GWR). GWR estimation quality strongly depends on the choice of the smoothing parameter. Typically for estimation purposes a range of the local area, or a number of nearest neighbors are fixed. However in practice objects can form clusters of different size and composition. For adaptive bandwidth selection a new algorithm for determining a set of nearest neighbors on the basis of analytical method ABC-analysis is proposed. The algorithm efficiency was tested in computing experiments and practical application in the estimation of residential real estate.

title: The numerical criterion of the compementary pair of bipolar transistors
conferenceTitle: 2016 13th International Scientific-Technical Conference on Actual Problems of Electronics Instrument Engineering (APEIE)
abstract: In this work, we introduced a new numeric, multi-parameter criterion of the complementary pair of bipolar transistors. Graphical form of the criterion is simple and clear. This criterion applies to all modern structures vertical bipolar transistors: classical planar-epitaxial, self - alignment with polysilicon layers, heterojunction bipolar transistors with Si-Ge epitaxial base.

title: An effective RNTI allocation scheme for user equipment in LTE systems
conferenceTitle: 2016 International Conference on Wireless Communications, Signal Processing and Networking (WiSPNET)
abstract: Long Term Evolution (LTE) is a technology, based on Third Generation partnership project (3GPP) which provides high data rates in the order of several hundreds of Mbps for data transmission. In order to achieve high data rates with good amount of spectral efficiency, it is required to allocate resources optimally. Physical Downlink Control Channel (PDCCH) is used to provide control information to the attached User equipment (UE). The resource elements to represent PDCCH are limited hence it is required to effectively allocate resources within this channel. The allocation of PDCCH resources for each UE is based on quantity of information and RB location depends on UE RNTI. This paper mainly focuses on effective method to allocate RNTI for UEs in order to minimize the Control Channel Element (CCE) collision. The proposed method of RNTI allocation has been compared with other existing methods using simulation.

title: Artificial vs. natural neural networks
conferenceTitle: 2016 13th Symposium on Neural Networks and Applications (NEUREL)
abstract: This presentation debates over the similarities and differences between artificial neural networks (ANN) versus natural ones. The animal brain's substructures were the initial models for the synthetic neural nets, but during last decades neuropsychologists also learn an important knowledge from the ANN. Currently, engineers perform research to diversify network architectures and to develop new and more efficient learning strategies while medical doctors try to better understand the way human brain process information. The authors present also some thoughts about the perspectives for the ANN development linked to the growing demand for artificial intelligence in many human fields of activity.

title: Single-fiber optical transmission system with DWDM channels. Effect OA four-wave mixing products
conferenceTitle: 2016 13th International Scientific-Technical Conference on Actual Problems of Electronics Instrument Engineering (APEIE)
abstract: Single-fiber optical transmission system (SFOTS) is offered, where the duplex is organized using dense wavelength division multiplexing (DWDM). The process of generating four-wave mixing products (FWM) occurring in optical fiber is modeled. The distribution of FWM products for the optical spectrum is investigated, as well as the number of products falling within the channel bandwidth.

title: Application method of barrier functions in the problem of estimating the probability density of the parameterized approximations
conferenceTitle: 2016 13th International Scientific-Technical Conference on Actual Problems of Electronics Instrument Engineering (APEIE)
abstract: The methods of obtaining a parameterized density function with a limited number of data. The solution of this problem by minimizing the functional. In the method of the barrier function minimization problem with inequality constraints reduced to solving a sequence of unconstrained minimization problems. The advantage of this approach lies in the number of restrictions is independent of the order of the polynomial. Practical implementation of the minimization of the above causes functional choice of basis functions and the required order of polynomials approximating the probability density function.

title: The design of shunts in light triggered power thyristor with integrated protection function from the effect of dV/dt
conferenceTitle: 2016 13th International Scientific-Technical Conference on Actual Problems of Electronics Instrument Engineering (APEIE)
abstract: The article examines the influence of the topology of the light triggered thyristor with a shorted main cathode and amplifying gate on the dV/dt effect. Derived the analytical condition for the topology, the implementation of which allows to realize integrated the function of protecting from the effect of dV/dt.

title: Using Dr. Fuzz, Dr. Memory, and Custom Dynamic Tools for Secure Development
conferenceTitle: 2016 IEEE Cybersecurity Development (SecDev)
abstract: This tutorial will present two tools that can be integrated into a secure software development approach, as well as describing how custom tools can be built utilizing the same underlying tool platform.

title: On finding zero dynamics for descriptor systems
conferenceTitle: 2016 13th International Scientific-Technical Conference on Actual Problems of Electronics Instrument Engineering (APEIE)
abstract: A brief overview of the latest results for the problems of quality control theory for the ordinary linear systems as well as the new problems for the above. A link has been noted between the problems in modal control by output feedback and the zero dynamics problem. Descriptor systems reduced to the canonical form and the related problems of zero dynamics were considered.

title: Impact of second generation plug-in battery electric vehicles on the aging of distribution transformers considering TOU prices
conferenceTitle: 2016 IEEE Power and Energy Society General Meeting (PESGM)
abstract: Summary form only given: This paper investigates the impact of secondgeneration (SG) plug-in battery electric vehicles (PBEVs) on distribution transformer's insulation life considering the time-of-use (TOU) prices. The effect of dual Level 2 charging, 3.7 kW, and 6.6 kW on the loss of life (LOL) of a distribution transformer is also studied. The LOL results demonstrating the effectiveness of SG PBEVs charging as two clusters versus one cluster are discussed and conclusions are drawn.

title: A CMOS buck converter with PFM / hysteretic mode
conferenceTitle: 2016 International SoC Design Conference (ISOCC)
abstract: This paper proposes design of a CMOS DC-DC buck converter with Fixed Hysteretic mode and PFM(Pulse Frequency Modulation) mode. The inherent problems of a slow transient time from heavy load to light load that the conventional Dual DC-DC buck converters with PWM/PFM mode has faced have been resolved by using the proposed DC-DC buck converter which employed Hysteretic mode in heavy load. It improves transient time in load regulation. This also can maintain range of wide load current, advantage of Dual mode buck converter. The proposed Dual Buck Converter is fabricated in 180nm CMOS 1-poly 6-metal process and occupies a core effective area of 1.35 mm2. Measurement environment are input voltage range of 2.7~3.3V, output voltage 1.2V and load current range from 10mA to 500mA. And measurement result shows that the maximum efficiency is 90% and ripple voltage is less 1.32mV.

title: Do you trust your chip?
conferenceTitle: 2016 International Conference on Design and Technology of Integrated Systems in Nanoscale Era (DTIS)
abstract: Globalization of Integrated Circuit (IC) design and manufacturing is making designers and users of ICs re-assess their trust in hardware. As the IC design flow spans the globe - driven by cost-conscious consumer electronics - hardware is increasingly prone to reverse engineering, Intellectual Property (IP) piracy and malicious modifications (i.e., hardware trojans). An attacker, anywhere within the global design flow, can reverse engineer the functionality of an IC/IP, steal and claim ownership of the IP or introduce counterfeits into the supply chain. Moreover, an untrusted IC fab may overbuild ICs and sell them illegally. Finally, rogue elements in the fabs may insert hardware trojans into the design without the knowledge of the designer or the end-user of the IC; this additional functionality may subsequently be exploited to introduce errors in the results, steal sensitive information or incapacitate a fielded system. The semiconductor industry routinely loses $billions annually due to these attacks. This talk will cover various forms of threats that the electronic chip supply chain is up against, as well as defenses against these threats. The talk will elucidate the development of CAD algorithms/tools for this newly emerging field by mostly leveraging principles from other more mature research domains.

title: Search the optimal combination of the geometric parameters of the ring magnet with a trapezoidal cross-section
conferenceTitle: 2016 International Conference on Actual Problems of Electron Devices Engineering (APEDE)
abstract: The article attempted to calculate the optimal combination of geometric parameters of an annular magnet with trapezoid cross-section. For this results value of the magnetic induction was calculated for a magnet with a trapezoidal cross-section with different thicknesses and different combinations of geometric parameters. The dependence, according to which one of the best combinations of geometric parameters of the magnet with a trapezoidal cross-section is a magnet with large thickness.

title: Classification and diagnosis of the parkinson disease by stacked autoencoder
conferenceTitle: 2016 National Conference on Electrical, Electronics and Biomedical Engineering (ELECO)
abstract: Parkinson disease is neuro-degenerative motion disorder this disease causes voice and speech dysfunctions. Therefore, disease can be diagnosed by determining dysphonia produced by a subject with parkinson diseases. In this paper we have introduced a new classification method of the parkinson disease which is based on the stacked autoencoder. The method is tested with two data sets and results show that the performance of the stacked autoencoder is significantly better than the-state-art-methods.

title: NATO Cooperative Cyber Defence Centre of Excellence
conferenceTitle: 2016 8th International Conference on Cyber Conflict (CyCon)
abstract: The Tallinn-based NATO Cooperative Cyber Defence Centre of Excellence (NATO CCD COE) is a NATO-accredited knowledge hub, think-tank and training facility. The international military organisation focuses on interdisciplinary applied research and development, as well as consultations, trainings and exercises in the field of cyber security. The Centre's mission is to enhance capability, cooperation and information-sharing between NATO, Allies and partners in cyber defence.

title: Application of local autonomous protection against voltage instability to IEEE test system
conferenceTitle: 2016 IEEE Power and Energy Society General Meeting (PESGM)
abstract: Summary form only given. This paper summarizes an instability monitoring and protection method based on local identification of global voltage instability (LIVES) and applies it to an IEEE test system for voltage stability and security assessment. The identification method (LIVES-alarm) is tested with both detailed and Quasi-Steady-State simulation tools, and two protection schemes, based respectively on reverse Load Tap Changer operation (LIVES-restore) and firm load shedding, are evaluated and compared using the unstable scenario provided with the test system. The effect of load sensitivity to voltage is also investigated.

title: Building the quietest space on earth: Precision optical systems for advanced LIGO
conferenceTitle: 2016 Conference on Lasers and Electro-Optics (CLEO)
abstract: Summary form only given. The recent detection of gravitational waves was made possible by the finest laser interferometers ever built. I will describe Advanced LIGO's optics, isolation, and control systems and discuss how the recent upgrades have changed our ability to “listen” to the universe.

title: Rhythmic spontaneous UPE in seedlings — overview
conferenceTitle: 2016 Progress in Electromagnetic Research Symposium (PIERS)
abstract: Summary form only given. The rhythmic features found in the spontaneous ultra-weak photon emission from seedlings, in the early stages of development, will be presented and discussed based in the results of past 10 years with wheat, corn and sunflower seeds. Synchronism with external triggers such gravimetric tide and geomagnetic cycles are studied and might give indications for further applications in chronobiology and agriculture.

title: PhD and doctorate consortium
conferenceTitle: 2016 11th International Conference for Internet Technology and Secured Transactions (ICITST)
abstract: Summary form only given, as follows. The complete presentation was not made available for publication as part of the conference proceedings. The idea of writing a research paper or developing a topic of research interest that can lead to a PhD / Doctorate degree or proposal is always an endless thinking of where, when, why, what and who. Therefore, becoming an experienced researcher and writer in any field or discipline takes a great deal of practice. The Consortium has the following objectives: • Provide a supportive setting for feedback on current research that will stimulate exchange of ideas; • Guide on the future research directions; • Promote the development of a supportive community of scholars and a spirit of collaborative research; • Contribute to the conference goals through interaction with other researchers and conference events.

title: Spectroscopic study of impurity ion radial distribution in an advanced beam-driven field reversed configuration
conferenceTitle: 2016 IEEE International Conference on Plasma Science (ICOPS)
abstract: Summary form only given. Impurity ion spectra ranging from vacuum ultra violet (vuv) to visible wavelengths was observed in an advanced beam-driven field-reversed configuration (FRC) plasmas1. Main impurity spectral lines were identified and modeled with the help of the collisional-radiative code NOMAD2. Impurity concentrations were estimated, based on the modeling results. Radial distribution of impurity charge states was reconstructed for the first time in an FRC experiment. Analysis of vuv spectra revealed quite low Zeff both inside and outside the FRC separatrix.

title: High-Q photonic crystal nanobeam cavities on silicon
conferenceTitle: 2016 Progress in Electromagnetic Research Symposium (PIERS)
abstract: Photonic crystal (PhC) nanobeam cavities have attracted increasing attention owing to the advantages of high Q-factor, small mode volume and no limitation of FSR. Various PhC cavities have been developed for optical communications, optical sensors, optomechanics, etc.. We investigate the design, fabrication, and experimental characterization of high quality factor PhCnanobeam cavities on silicon. The results show that PhCnanobeam cavities have the potential to ful?ll the aforementioned requirements and form a building block for achieving on-chip optical filtering and sensing applications.

title: New bibliometric analysis of research institutions network
conferenceTitle: 2016 Portland International Conference on Management of Engineering and Technology (PICMET)
abstract: To understand academic research, bibliometric analysis is tremendously important at any aspects. Research institutions such as university, institution and research center, are focal point of academic research. We have used simple and quantitative bibliometric analysis for the evaluation of research institutions. Nowadays some study show qualitative and network-based bibliometric analysis has been implemented for this purpose as a new approach. As such a new approach, this research shows network-based bibliometric analysis to understand research institutions characteristics qualitatively and show new standard for the evaluation of research institutions, using co-authorship analysis. As a result and discussion, we suggested some network index may represent their institutions' academic situation and power on their field and country.

conferenceTitle: 2016 13th International Scientific-Technical Conference on Actual Problems of Electronics Instrument Engineering (APEIE)
abstract: The characteristics of silicon oscillistor sensors with frequency output and oscillistor resistance-tofrequency converter (RF-converter) are discussed. The prospects oscillistor RF-converter for producing on its basis the various sensors with frequency output when the sensing element is a photo-, magnetic-, tenso-, thermo-, or variable resistor (linear and angular motion sensor), and converter resistance-to-frequency will be oscillistor.

title: Improvement of bodipy-based bulk heterojunction solar cell using 1,8-diodooctane
conferenceTitle: 2016 Progress in Electromagnetic Research Symposium (PIERS)
abstract: In this work, we investigate the effect of a solvent additive, 1,8-diodooctane (DIO), in a bodipy-based bulk-heterojunction solar cells. By using 0.2 vol% DIO, the power conversion efficiency (PCE) increased from 1.97% to 2.49%. This improvement was mostly due to the increase in the fill factor. The effect of solvent additive on photophysical property and microscopic morphology of the device is also discussed.

conferenceTitle: 2016 Optical Fiber Communications Conference and Exhibition (OFC)
abstract: Using Ethernet in the fronthaul can deliver the statistical multiplexing gains offered by the new functional splits proposed for the radio access network, but latency and delay variations are challenges that must be overcome.

title: Decentralized control of oscillatory dynamics in power systems using an extended LQR
conferenceTitle: 2016 IEEE Power and Energy Society General Meeting (PESGM)
abstract: Summary form only given. This paper proposes a decentralized algorithm for real-time control of oscillatory dynamics in power systems. The algorithm integrates dynamic state estimation (DSE) with an extended linear quadratic regulator (ELQR) for optimal control. The control for one generation unit only requires measurements and parameters for that unit, and hence the control at a unit remains completely independent of other units. The control gains are updated in real-time, therefore the control scheme remains valid for any operating condition. The applicability of the proposed algorithm has been demonstrated on a representative power system model.

title: More than Moore's law — Scaling with silicon photonics
conferenceTitle: 2016 International Symposium on VLSI Design, Automation and Test (VLSI-DAT)
abstract: Rapid growth of intelligent mobile devices and internet of things demand instantaneous and ubiquitous access to large amount of data stored in remote data centers. This growth drives the need of very large capacity processors to store, switch and route vast amount of data. With the electronics industry embracing the "More-than-Moore" concept to increase the integration level of the data processors, future generations of CMOS technology must not only scale transistor dimensions, but also need to embrace various heterogeneous integration technologies with new processing architectures. The emerging silicon photonics technology, which is compatible with the main stream CMOS manufacturing processes, promises significant enhancement in processing speed and capacity. In this talk, we will review the current status of the silicon photonics technology and new capability it would enable.

title: Recent advances in non-linear fiber propagation modeling
conferenceTitle: 2016 Optical Fiber Communications Conference and Exhibition (OFC)
abstract: Substantial advances in the modeling of non-linear fiber propagation have recently been made. Advantages and limitations of various proposed models are outlined and discussed. The still open problems and future challenges, including non-linearity mitigation, are discussed.

conferenceTitle: 2016 Conference on Lasers and Electro-Optics (CLEO)
abstract: Summary form only given. Advanced LIGO has directly observed gravitational waves during its first science run. In this talk I will discuss the astrophysical reach of LIGO interferometers during the run and prospects for the future.

abstract: We demonstrate a quantum memory using the optical phonon modes of room-temperature diamond [1, 2]. The memory stores THz-bandwidth single photons produced by parametric down-conversion for several picoseconds and offers operations upon the stored light.

conferenceTitle: 2016 Conference on Lasers and Electro-Optics (CLEO)
abstract: A silicon-on-insulator based optical link is introduced. Higher opto-coupling efficiency and temperature-resilience are obtained via avalanche-mode light-emitting diode operation against forward-mode operation. Self-heating induced thermo-coupling in steady-state is de-embedded by calibrating the photo-detector's photovoltaic characteristics.

title: The design and study of the system of computer network traffic using the secure virtual communication channel technology
conferenceTitle: 2016 13th International Scientific-Technical Conference on Actual Problems of Electronics Instrument Engineering (APEIE)
abstract: The paper addresses one of the possible approaches to computer network traffic control based on encapsulated secure virtual communication channels. The design and study of the commercial VPN service with an open source code is considered in the paper. The results of the experiments aimed to identify the intercepted traffic types and to decode it are presented. This work resulted in developing an open-source VPN service based on the proposed algorithm and promoting secure communication channel technologies.

title: Stability probabilities of terminal sliding mode control of manipulator systems with Markovian jumpings
conferenceTitle: 2016 14th International Workshop on Variable Structure Systems (VSS)
abstract: This paper investigates the stability probabilities of terminal sliding mode control of the continuous manipulator systems with Markovian jumpings. The proposed sliding manifold is a nonsingular sliding mode, which can be reached in a finite time. Furthermore, we discuss the situation that the control force is not strong enough, and then propose the reaching probability and sliding probability. A numerical example is given to show the effectiveness of the theoretical results.

title: PWM controller design for DC motor drive via time-scale separation technique
conferenceTitle: 2016 13th International Scientific-Technical Conference on Actual Problems of Electronics Instrument Engineering (APEIE)
abstract: The problem of a DC motor speed control is discussed. DC motor is equipped with autonomous voltage inverter and pulse-width modulator. Proportional-integral (PI) controller is designed for motor speed control based on singular perturbation technique such that multi-time-scale motions are artificially induced in the closed-loop system. Multi-time-scale motions analysis allows getting analytical expressions for selection of controller parameters. Robustness of the closed-loop system properties is maintained. Simulation results are presented as well.

title: The simulation system and research of functions of random variables
conferenceTitle: 2016 13th International Scientific-Technical Conference on Actual Problems of Electronics Instrument Engineering (APEIE)
abstract: The questions of research of the distribution laws of one-dimensional functions of a set of independent random variables are considered. The subsystem that allow for implementing the imitation modeling of different functions of a set of independent random variables and investigating these distribution laws is implemented. System capabilities illustrated the efficiency of this method is demonstrated in set of examples.

title: HPDAV 2016 Keynote
conferenceTitle: 2016 IEEE International Parallel and Distributed Processing Symposium Workshops (IPDPSW)
abstract: The HPC industry is in the midst of unprecedented change. Everything about how HPC systems are used and built is evolving to support more complex models with ever-increasing data sets. Scientists, engineers, and designers around the world are driving these high performance computing trends to fuel their insights. These insights, in turn, lead to better products, quicker discoveries, and better decisions than ever before. These factors require a transformation in HPC system design, a focus on code modernization plus rethinking how analysis tools scale to match users and developers' needs. We will discuss how the Intel® Scaleable System Framework enables a broad and growing set of workloads and then delve into the benefits of Software Defined Visualization to meet the demand to improve analysis of continually growing data models.

title: Risk monitoring of the activity in the verification laboratory
conferenceTitle: 2016 13th International Scientific-Technical Conference on Actual Problems of Electronics Instrument Engineering (APEIE)
abstract: This article reviews issues of the event probability including monitoring of the laboratory activity against accreditation criteria of national system of accreditation for resolving problem of laboratory condition including requirements for assurance of measurements' uniformity.

title: Accurate phasor estimation during power swing
conferenceTitle: 2016 IEEE Power and Energy Society General Meeting (PESGM)
abstract: Summary form only given. Modulation of voltage and current signals with low frequency component during power swing creates difficulty in accurate phasor estimation. Sequence component based relaying principles are therefore being affected. In this paper, fundamental and modulating frequency components are incorporated in phasor estimation formulation to improve the accuracy. The method estimates the two frequencies first and then the phasor using least squares technique. As an application of the proposed method, the sequence component of current is used for detection of unbalanced fault during power swing. The method is tested for numerous power swing and fault conditions of a WSCC 9-bus system and compared with conventional methods.

title: Smart and simple method for encrypting and decrypting image based on crossover of GA
conferenceTitle: 2016 International Conference on Information Communication and Embedded Systems (ICICES)
abstract: The current age is called the age of information technology. The security of transmitting and storing this information are facing a huge challenge. Traditional and classical methods are not suitabel to protect this information, especially when the type of this information is a part of multimedia such as image, audio and video. This type of information needs the high level of security. For that purpose, many researchers designed novel and smart techniques and methods. In this paper suggests a new algorithm to investiage the quality of encryption based on genetic algorithm to find out an optimization solution for security, robustness, quality and speed of encryption algorithm. In this method, the genetic algorithm has been incorportaed within encryption algorithm to find a optimization solution minimize possible time and maximize the performance algorithm.

title: Modeling the chemical kinetics of dual pulsed plasma sources for reduction of NOx emission
conferenceTitle: 2016 IEEE International Conference on Plasma Science (ICOPS)
abstract: Summary form only given. The remediation of NOx emission from diesel exhaust or gas turbines has been widely studied for atmospheric pollution and human health. In order to reduce exhaust gases, non-thermal atmospheric plasmas, Selective Catalytic Reduction(SCR), and SCR with plasma technology have been use. SCR with plasma technology has the highest efficiency to remove NOx emission. However, because of the high maintenance cost and frequent replacement of catalysts, plasma technology not in combination with a catalyst has been interesting. We investigate the efficiency of NOx reduction by dual pulsed atmospheric air plasma sources. NOx concentration is controlled by the variation of high frequency and low frequency of dual pulsed plasma. In Global simulation, a detailed reaction mechanism about NO, NO2, N2O remediation is proposed with single pulse and dual pulses. Main reactions are use d to develop 1-D fluid and hybrid simulation. In these simulations, spatial distribution of radicals and electron densities is investigated. Major pathway of NOx concentration is presented in different spatial position. In this research, simulation results show that dual pulsed plasma can reduce NOx emission more than single pulsed plasma. It can be a new solution for NOx reduction.

title: Process variation estimation for passive ladder circuit by means of interval analysis
conferenceTitle: 2016 13th International Scientific-Technical Conference on Actual Problems of Electronics Instrument Engineering (APEIE)
abstract: In this article a new technique of process variation estimation in electrical circuit is presented. Technique is based on interval analysis application for a ladder circuit. Using this particular class of electrical circuit high speed of calculation could be achieved which is important in optimization and automated synthesis. In the article general ability of the technique application for a resistor circuit (with real impedance) is shown. Also ways of the technique extension for general circuit (with complex impedance) is discussed. Now the technique application is limited to passive network. The numerical experiments showed an agreement obtained results with statistical modeling with Monte Carlo Method. Further development of the technique is the extension to microwave circuit.

title: Static equivalent method based on component particularity representation and sensitivity consistency
conferenceTitle: 2016 IEEE Power and Energy Society General Meeting (PESGM)
abstract: A new method on static external equivalent network is proposed. The method represents the equivalence of different component types and ensures the consistency of both power flow states and sensitivities of variables in the internal network before and after equivalence. Compared to the existing equivalent methods that only consider the power flow state consistency but ignore component particularity representation and sensitivity consistency, the proposed method is more accurate and effective. The simulation results of the 39-bus system and an actual 661-bus utility system demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed method.

abstract: If technologies of OAM (orbital angular momentum) modes are feasible for RF communication, it can greatly increase the information transmission capacity. For its applicability in RF area we have to resolve two obstacles of technologies.

title: Methods for improving parameters of power consumption and received data reliability in wireless mobile ecg monitoring system
conferenceTitle: 2016 13th International Scientific-Technical Conference on Actual Problems of Electronics Instrument Engineering (APEIE)
abstract: To reduce the volume of transmitted data, we propose to use the characteristics of cycle codes at the protocol of data transmission with the help of asynchronous transceiver that lets refuse the start marker and the counter giving the length of the transmitted package We considered the peculiarities the adaptive forming of training set for the revealing distorted of areas in electrocardiogram with help of support vector machine.

title: Sequential estimation and diffusion of information over networks
conferenceTitle: 2016 13th Symposium on Neural Networks and Applications (NEUREL)
abstract: Collaborative estimation of parameters of stochastic models in networks from observations made by individual nodes is a core topic in the field of signal and information processing over networks. In this talk, we formulate the problem of collaborative sequential estimation of unknown parameters where information in the network diffuses with time. The formulation is abstract and independent from any particular model. Our objective is to reach a generic solution that is applicable to a wide class of popular models. We adopt the Bayesian and information-theoretic paradigms so that we have at our disposal probabilistically consistent means for incorporation of the observations in the implemented estimation and for effective combination of the gained “knowledge” by the nodes in the network. The presented theory will be demonstrated by examples. They include linear regression, Kalman filtering, logistic regression, and inference of an inhomogeneous Poisson process.

title: Neural network application for assessment of the asynchronous motors energy consumption
conferenceTitle: 2016 13th International Scientific-Technical Conference on Actual Problems of Electronics Instrument Engineering (APEIE)
abstract: The article deals with the estimation of the asynchronous motors power consumption using the neural networks. As asynchronous motors with squirrel-cage rotor are the largest part of the industrial enterprises load, the change of their power consumption at the voltage deviations can affect the operating modes of the enterprise power supply system and other electrical receivers. Application of neural networks allows to determine the non-linear regularities in noisy heterogeneous data, provides valid calculations results in a large number of input parameters. At presence of input data for network training the created neural network helps simply enough to find the power consumption of an asynchronous motor at electric network voltage deviations from the nominal value in a wide range of voltages, load factor changes, and also if it is necessary of other data initial.

title: An investigation of statistical properties of parameter estimates of distributions on interval data
conferenceTitle: 2016 13th International Scientific-Technical Conference on Actual Problems of Electronics Instrument Engineering (APEIE)
abstract: This paper discusses the issues of estimation of distribution parameters on interval data. It has to deal with interval data samples in situations when the exact value of the observation is unknown, only to the range to which the value belongs is known. In general, these intervals are different for each case and may intersect. The maximum likelihood method can be used for estimating the distribution parameters. The purpose of this paper is to investigate the statistical properties of maximum likelihood estimators (MLE) on interval data. The research was conducted in comparison with the estimates of the distribution parameters on point samples of observation interval midpoints.

title: Quantum communication for tomorrow
conferenceTitle: 2016 IEEE Photonics Conference (IPC)
abstract: Quantum physics allows for completely new ways to create, manipulate and store information. Quantum communication, the ability to transmit quantum information, is a primitive for any future quantum Internet. Here we present an overview of this field ranging from quantum key distribution to quantum networks.

title: Halide Perovskite Quantum Dots: New Generation Materials for Display Applications
conferenceTitle: 2016 Asia Communications and Photonics Conference (ACP)
abstract: Halide perovskite quantum dots exhibit high photoluminescence quantum yields, wide wavelength tenability, and ultra-narrow band emission. The combination of these superior optical properties and low cost fabrication makes them to be potential candidates for display technology.

title: Silicon photonic integrated circuits
conferenceTitle: 2016 Progress in Electromagnetic Research Symposium (PIERS)
abstract: In this talk, we review the technical merits of silicon photonic devices and integrated circuits, which have benefited from high-index-contrast silicon waveguides, a high integration level of various optical functions on the same chips, and mature complementary metal-oxide semiconductor (CMOS) fabrication techniques. These technical merits assure silicon photonics as a disruptive optical technology that will achieve low-cost and compact optical modules for data communications, with applications such as chip-scale optical interconnects, short-reach communications in datacenters and supercomputers, and metro/long-haul optical transmissions. In particular, we review silicon photonic circuits for wavelength-division multiplexing (WDM) transmitters, WDM receivers, coherent optical transmitters and coherent receivers, photonic networks-on-chip, and silicon photonic light sources.

title: COMPLEX “BioMon” for the medical mobile biomonitoring development
conferenceTitle: 2016 13th International Scientific-Technical Conference on Actual Problems of Electronics Instrument Engineering (APEIE)
abstract: “BioMon” diagnostic system for monitoring human's body functional parameters: blood oxygenation (SpO2), electrocardiography (ECG), heart rate (HR), respiratory rate (BH), body temperature (Tm) and physical activity (PA) was developed. The software has diagnostic algorithms for diagnosis of sleep and the threat of life of the user. The central monitoring station and samples of patient's module (MP BioMon) were made. Patient's module is a set of wearable sensors. Information from the sensors is transmitted by radio to the base station. The tests showed that the complex is able to provide the monitoring and analysis of up to 16 patients at a time.

title: The present and future of Moore's law
conferenceTitle: 2016 International Symposium on VLSI Technology, Systems and Application (VLSI-TSA)
abstract: I will give an overview of industry leading and state of art Intel 14nm technology, present key results and enabling innovations, and highlight technology values for the products. I will briefly review the history of Moore's law, discuss challenges for continual silicon scaling, and describe important vectors in advancing Moore's law in the future.

title: [Panel] Many-core reality check - How increasing core counts, on-node networks, and deep integration will impact system interconnects
conferenceTitle: 2016 IEEE 24th Annual Symposium on High-Performance Interconnects (HOTI)
abstract: Summary form only given, as follows. The complete presentation was not made available for publication as part of the conference proceedings. Node architectures have entered an era of intense innovation, with trends toward increasing numbers of devices per processor; integration of memory and the introduction of new memory technologies; and rapid increases in the scale of on-chip, on-package, and on-node networks. These trends, in turn, are influencing the design of network architectures and redefining the interaction between nodes and the network. In this session, our panelists will critically evaluate these trends to identify key issues that must be solved by the coming generations of high-speed networking technologies.

title: Elements of data mining for the development of mathematical transport models
conferenceTitle: 2016 13th International Scientific-Technical Conference on Actual Problems of Electronics Instrument Engineering (APEIE)
abstract: Issues of estimating transport origin-destination (OD) flows in terms of transport systems modelling with the utility of elements of the data mining are considered. Methods of extracting hidden patterns of origin-destination flows of the population based on the mobile operator's data are provided. The hypothesis of a model type describing a subscriber belonging to some specific population stratum is checked based on proxy factors in the form of a decision tree and subscriber's stratification is conducted. An iterative algorithm for constructing origin-destination matrices using methods of regression analysis is provided based on the knowledge obtained. The comparison of preference functions of the gravity model of the origin-destination matrix estimation is conducted. An investigation of origin-destination flows calculation method is carried out in the transport model of Novosibirsk city.

title: Key enablers for 3D sequential integration
conferenceTitle: 2016 International Symposium on VLSI Technology, Systems and Application (VLSI-TSA)
abstract: 3D sequential integrations such as CoolCubeTM appear to be an alternative to planar scaling for the next generation nodes by stacking CMOS over CMOS and even transistors above transistors. This is possible thanks to high alignment accuracy depending only on the lithography stepper and not on the bonder performance, as in packaging technologies. Performance gain can be obtained either by optimizing each level independently or by the reduction in interconnect delay and thus, optimization of device partitioning and global routing. In this paper, data on the bottom transistors stability and some key enablers to realize a top transistor level at low temperature will be presented.

title: Synthesis of servosystems using method linear-quadratic optimization
conferenceTitle: 2016 13th International Scientific-Technical Conference on Actual Problems of Electronics Instrument Engineering (APEIE)
abstract: The methodology of application of linear-quadratic optimization for problems of sequential regulation, where it is necessary to watch the dynamic processes in the environment is developed in the paper. The generalized scheme of control system combining the principles of the construction of classical single-loop regulation systems and stabilization systems with feedback condition is in its base. The proposed solutions represent the idea of conversion of stabilization problems for tracking problems in connection with class of systems with zero steady-state tracking error.

title: Dephasing length optimization by controlling plasma density in laser wakefield accelerators
conferenceTitle: 2016 IEEE International Conference on Plasma Science (ICOPS)
abstract: Summary form only given. The energy gain of an electron beam in the laser-driven plasma wave can be limited by dephasing between the accelerated electron bunch and the plasma wave. The dephasing length is defined as the length the electrons travel before it phase slip by one-half period of plasma wave. Since the velocity of the accelerated electrons is higher than the phase velocity of plasma wave, the electrons outrun the plasma wave and moves into decelerating region of the plasma wave phase space. In order to enlarge the dephasing length, the plasma wavelength should be increased by optimizing the plasma density profile. We report the measurements of dephasing length using plasma density distribution with linear, up-ramp and parabolic profile. The accelerated electron energy gain is calculated in different plasma density profiles. We observe that the plasma wavelength decreases when the plasma wave propagates from low to high-density layer. After density transition, the accelerated electron phase synchronizes with the phase of plasma wave. This increases the electron acceleration length and improves the beam quality. This may be crucial to determine the electron beam energy in LWFA.

title: Programmable integrated Photonics for space division (de)multiplexing
conferenceTitle: 2016 18th International Conference on Transparent Optical Networks (ICTON)
abstract: InP and Silicon Photonics integrated optical devices able to mux and demux signals encoded on different orthogonal modes. They operate on 2 and 4 channels at 10 Gbit/s with less than −15 dB residual crosstalk. Transparent photodetectors, realized though the non-invasive ContacLess Integrated Photonic Probe (CLIPP) technology are exploited to assist the (de)mux configuration.
